content: If I declare my mymodule.settings config file in hook_config_info() and create a default config file, the mymodule.settings.json file is created automatically in the config directory upon module installation, yay. But when I disable+uninstall the module, that file is left behind in the active config folder (unless I explicitly remove it in hook_uninstall()). Shouldn't it be automatically removed from the active config folder upon uninstallation? This page says so. But it's not happening with 1.17.4.
Ah hah. I guess it helps if hook_config_info() actually returns $prefixes. (The auto-generated version from coder_upgrade module leaves out the "return $prefixes" line.)

I noticed that too: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/coder_upgrade/issues/28
